intro: Lasianthera parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered lasianthera, is a flowering plant species native to parts of Southeast Asia. It is a herbaceous plant with slender stems and opposite leaves that are usually ovate to elliptic in shape. The flowers are small and white, clustered in dense inflorescences at the ends of the branches. It typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories. The plant is of interest in botanical studies due to its unique floral structure and ecological adaptations.
